briefdescription.para: This is used to access private members in Regex.
Subject string for match.
PCRE2 options for pcre2_match() (PCRE2 internal function)
JPCRE2 options for match.
Pointer to vector that will store the numbered substring maps.
Pointer to vector that will store the named substring maps.
Pointer to vector that will store the name to number maps.
Pointer to map that will store numbered substrings temporarily.
Pointer to map that will store named substrings temporarily.
Pointer to map that will store name to number mapping temporarily.
Define class Regex as friend and thus allow Regex to create object of this class.
Populate num_map0 with numbered substrings.
Populate nas_map0 and/or ntn_map0 with named substring and/or name to number mapping.

parameterdescription.para: Size of each entry in the name table.

briefdescription.para: Push maps into the vectors pointed by vec_num, vec_nas and vec_ntn and thus store match results in them.
Initialize class variables.

detaileddescription.para: Do not call this without releasing vector/map memory.

briefdescription.para: Default constructor.
This is a copy constructor which is only used to prevent public object creation.

detaileddescription.para: No need to implement it completely.

briefdescription.para: Destructor.

detaileddescription.para: Deletes the temporary maps that were created to store substrings

briefdescription.para: Get subject string.
Get modifier string calculated from JPCRE2 and PCRE2 options.

detaileddescription.para: Calculate modifier string from match_opts and jpcre2_match_opts and return it.

briefdescription.para: Get PCRE2 option.
Get JPCRE2 option.
Reset errors to zero.

detaileddescription.para: If you wanna examine the error status of a function call in the method chain, add this function just before your target function so that the error is set to zero before that target function is called, and leave everything out after the target function so that there will be no additional errors from other functions.

This function is callable from everywhere in a method chain. i.e other copy of this function for other classes are available and they do the exactly same thing.
A reference to the RegexMatch object
Regex::resetErrors()
RegexReplace::resetErrors()

briefdescription.para: Set a pointer to the numbered substring vector of type jpcre2::VecNum.
Set a pointer to the named substring vector of type jpcre2::VecNas.
Set a pointer to the name to number map vector of type jpcre2::VecNtN.
Set the subject string m_subject.
Set the modifier (overwrites existing JPCRE2 and PCRE2 option).

detaileddescription.para: Re-initializes the option bits for PCRE2 and JPCRE2 options, then parses the modifier to set their equivalent options.

Note: If speed of operation is very crucial, use RegexMatch::setJpcre2Option() and RegexMatch::setPcre2Option() with equivalent options. It will be faster that way.
s
Modifier string
RegexMatch&
RegexReplace::setModifier()
Regex::setModifier()

briefdescription.para: Set JPCRE2 option jpcre2_match_opts (overwrite existing option)
Set PCRE2 option match_opts (overwrite existing option)
Set whether to perform global match.
This is an overloaded member function, provided for convenience. It differs from the above function only in what argument(s) it accepts.
This function just calls RegexMatch::setFindAll(bool x) with true as the parameter.
Parse modifier and add/remove equivalent PCRE2 and JPCRE2 options.

detaileddescription.para: After a call to this function match_opts and jpcre2_match_opts will be properly set.
This function does not initialize or re-initialize options. If you want to set options from scratch, initialize them to their default values before calling this function.

Note: If speed of operation is very crucial, use RegexMatch::changeJpcre2Option() and RegexMatch::changePcre2Option() with equivalent options. It will be faster that way.
mod
Modifier string
x
Whether to add or remove options
RegexMatch&
RegexReplace::changeModifier()
Regex::changeModifier()

briefdescription.para: Add or remove a JPCRE2 option.

parameterdescription.para: Add the option if it's true, remove otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Add or remove a PCRE2 option.

parameterdescription.para: Add the option if it's true, remove otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Parse modifier string and add equivalent PCRE2 and JPCRE2 options.

detaileddescription.para: This is just a wrapper of the original function RegexMatch::changeModifier() provided for convenience.

Note: If speed of operation is very crucial, use RegexMatch::addJpcre2Option() and RegexMatch::addPcre2Option() with equivalent options. It will be faster that way.
mod
Modifier string
RegexMatch&
RegexReplace::addModifier()
Regex::addModifier()

briefdescription.para: Add option to existing JPCRE2 options jpcre2_match_opts.
Add option to existing PCRE2 options match_opts.
Store match result in vectors and return the number of matches.

detaileddescription.para: Clear the specified vectors (vec_num, vec_nas, vec_ntn) and re-fill them with match results, then return the match count.
The size of each vectors should be equal to the match count. The return value is guaranteed to give you the right match count.

para.ref: Regex::match(const String& s, const String& mod)

briefdescription.para: Provides the RegexMatch::match() function to perform regex matching.

detaileddescription.para: Provides chained methods to set various options.
All constructors of this class are private.
